title: Core CSE
content: I'm an ECE student and I'll be entering my second semester now, I really love programming and want to end up in a CSE job, but my first semester GPA is horrible (7.95) so it's gonna be really hard for me to change to CSE. My question is should I start hardcore programming? C programming is a core subject in semester 2, so I was wondering if I should start DSAs and all the topics that are important for a CSE major.

comments.body: U could consider moving to CS in ec campus if u really like cs. The cutoff is around 7.5
Got 6.8 bro . Feel better about urself my score is absolute üêï shit

People usually get more in second sem. Try to get an 8.5 atleast.

Last year cs in ec campus was 7.4 for branch change, and now they have aiml there too so that would probably be lower. If you're interested take it
You could get a branch change with your cgpa. Take CS (either campus) over AiMl. AIML should be the last option (it can make your CS prospects narrow compared to core CS)
